edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.gui.editor

Class GEditorPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.gui.editor.GEditorPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GAlgorithmEditorPanel, GCompiledAlgorithmEditorPanel, GGraphEditorPanel

    public abstract class GEditorPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements javax.swing.event.DocumentListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
    Abstract class for the editor window's text panes.
    Author:
    Jason Cockrell, Ty Devries, Alex McCabe, Michael Owoc
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • parentPane

        protected final GTabbedPane parentPane
        The wholistic instance of the editor associated with this panel. In any running instance of Galant, there should be only one. Thus once initialized, this should never change.

      • lineNumbers

        protected javax.swing.JTextArea lineNumbers

      • textPane

        protected javax.swing.JTextPane textPane
        The actual text editor pane associated with this edit session, as distinguished from the surrounding buttons, etc.

      • tbr

        protected edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.gui.editor.GTabbedPane.TabRenderer tbr
        The renderer for the tab on this edit session, which should be updated if the file name changes or the file is dirtied.

      • syntaxHighlighter

        protected java.lang.Runnable syntaxHighlighter

      • isDirty

        protected boolean isDirty
        Is the current edit session dirty?

      • fileName

        protected java.lang.String fileName
        The name of the file including a .txt/.alg extension.

      • filePath

        protected java.lang.String filePath
        Confusingly, the path and name of the file including an extension.
